channel.title: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites
channel.description: Can someone tell me the offsets for the npc and wieldable item sprites and where they are in the client, thanks

item.title: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“gawdz666, post:8, topic:349884”][quote author=yong min link=topic=446259.msg3278992#msg3278992 date=1279750422]

Well I tried to work it out and come up with the sprite ID 250 for the item ID 1325 but that was the first one I tried and it doesn’t seem to be working. Do you understand how the Animations.RSCD file plays a function in wieldable items? I’m pretty sure you need to add an entry in there, and I did, but I can’t find any reference on the server to the def names in there so meh?

Sprites are a real pain. I presume you have increased the amount of bytes? The default will only allow 255 or 256, w/e the amount is. I think this somehow is represent with the in your ItemWieldableDef… As for Animations, I think it somehow corresponds with the order of your ItemWieldableDef… I’m not sure the name in there really matters…

@gawdz, a quick click of the refresh button before saving the sprite fixed that problem…
[/quote]

or coding it to properly save the value upon save fixes it too ;)[/quote]
Yes I am refreshing the sprite editor before saving ;p the thought of fixing it really never crossed my mind, lol, but I guess I should at some point.

Anyway, I do still need help. I still don’t know what to put into my ItemWieldableDef for the sprite number. You mentioned upping the byte value, but if the sprite id is 250 and 255 is the max, there shouldn’t be a problem

Read full topic
item.source: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites

Sprites are a real pain. I presume you have increased the amount of bytes? The default will only allow 255 or 256, w/e the amount is. item.title: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

KO9:

Well I tried to work it out and come up with the sprite ID 250 for the item ID 1325 but that was the first one I tried and it doesn’t seem to be working. Do you understand how the Animations.RSCD file plays a function in wieldable items? I’m pretty sure you need to add an entry in there, and I did, but I can’t find any reference on the server to the def names in there so meh?

Sprites are a real pain. I presume you have increased the amount of bytes? The default will only allow 255 or 256, w/e the amount is. I think this somehow is represent with the in your ItemWieldableDef… As for Animations, I think it somehow corresponds with the order of your ItemWieldableDef… I’m not sure the name in there really matters…

@gawdz, a quick click of the refresh button before saving the sprite fixed that problem…

item.title: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

With item sprites the sprite editor had a bug in it with saving the x and y shift im assuming you fixed that.

The animation is just the color “mask” to the item/npc/object etc etc.

If you want to know more contact me on msn.

Read full topic

item.source: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites

item.title: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

Yeah, i’ve come across this before, I don’t do any rsc coding, but i’ve done alot of stuff around sprites,
imo it’s messy, everythings numbered fugly,

I’d say with your code,
1325 = Item ID,
250 = Sprite

And then there would be preset functions to do the math,
Because you have 8 different directions, with 3 sprites per direction,
Plus fighting sprites,

So i’d say 250 = first south facing sprite, and it does the addition from there
I maybe a bit off track, I don’t fully understand what you mean

Read full topic
item.source: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites

item.title: Custom NPC and Wieldable item sprites
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

The offsets as in the integer the client starts with for the sprite ids.

Edit:

public static final int SPRITE_ITEM_START = 2150;

This is part of what I was after.

Edit2:

Meh, need to figure out how this Sprite number correlates to the sprite id used in the client.

        <entry>
                <int>1325</int>
                <ItemWieldableDef>
                        <sprite>250</sprite>
                        <type>16</type>
                        <wieldPos>4</wieldPos>
                        <armourPoints>100</armourPoints>
                        <weaponAimPoints>80</weaponAimPoints>
                        <weaponPowerPoints>40</weaponPowerPoints>
                        <magicPoints>70</magicPoints>
                        <prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints>
                        <rangePoints>70</rangePoints>
                        <requiredStats />
                        <femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly>
                </ItemWieldableDef>
        </entry>

Read full topic
